ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Loved this course
I learned so much about ecology. As a premed this was a different view and this was one of the best and most fun classes I took this semester
basic biology lab skills (microscope usages, etc.); report writing skills

Since we did not have permanent lab partners, I got to work with many different students and I learned to collaborate with them. I learned to think more critically about the evolution of different organisms and how a niche is developed for a specific animal.
I learned more about the purpose of evolutionary bio for the rest of the field and how prevalent these tops are in modern day life

Each week we explored a different aspect of the evolutionary tree by exploring related organisms or plant life, from invertebrates to fish to flowers and streams. Did a variety of dissections analyses and field trips

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Prof and TAs were very invested in material which added to moral of class

Strengths: dr. Wells is great, the assignments and labs are super fun.

Weaknesses: grading could be faster

the professor is wonderful! she cares deeply about her students and makes the course really enjoyable and exciting each week because she is so excited about the material. the experiments are also pretty fun and diverse. and you go on a field trip which is great. the quizzes are pretty straightforward as long as your review the material beforehand. 

the lab reports (the small ones and the large ones) are really time-consuming. just as note

The strengths of this course was the faculty that taught it. The professor and the TF's were beyond supportive and kind and helpful. They made the course as great as it was. A weakness of this course may be that the mini lab reports were about just as much work as the full lab reports but were worth significantly less points.

Lab assignments werent graded till the end, so we didnt get much feedback during the class. This class also took the entire listed time and at many points, the purpose of lab activities felt unclear. Lots of busywork.
This class was amazing. Best lab I've taken at Yale. Marta cares so much about the subject matter and her energy is infectious.
The material was interesting and engaging but it was hard to gauge the level of challenge some assignments would have to get quick feedback on out work

Strengths the teaching team is fabulous and the course is well organized and extremely engaging. My favorite lab course at Yale Ive ever taken 

Weakness the workload felt like  lot, especially having the quizzes on top of weekly lab report. The quizzes expected us to know so much information. We did not receive grades in a timely manner

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, I think it is great
Please take this course. Best lab class at yale
Yes!
yes, if you need a bio lab for any of the bio majors or as a premed this is a great option. or if you're interested in ecology.
Yes! I would recommend this course to any student who wants to have a more hand on experience in a bio lab and learn from many different approaches.
Yes definitely

Absolutely! Pretty straightforward lab. We often got out early and they weren't super stressful. The Yale Nature Walk project was really fun to do and visiting the river was alaso a great experience. The quizzes are super fair and grading is not harsh. Marta is amazing!
Yes the course was very fun and engaging

YES ABSOLUTELY YES!! Such a positive environment for a lab course and I got to experience parts of Yale and new haven that I never would have before. I have a greater appreciation for the work ecologists do
